paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the V142I variant in the TTR gene, its association with transthyretin levels, and the implications for heart failure and mortality.

patients.phenotype: Lower transthyretin levels compared to non-carriers

functional_data.summary: Carriers of the V142I variant have lower TTR levels, which are associated with increased risk of heart failure and mortality.

variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the clinical significance of the V142I variant in relation to TTR levels and cardiovascular outcomes.
key_quotes: V142I carriers [n = 39, mean: −0.5 (0.3)] had lower adjusted TTR levels compared with the non-carriers [n = 35,167, mean: −0.1 (0.3)] (p < 0.001).

tables_processed.table_caption: Baseline characteristics stratified by V142I TTR variant carrier status
Association of clinical correlates with transthyretin levels
Association of study outcomes with transthyretin levels

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the V142I variant in the TTR gene.
